meanings.sent1: The temporizer kept postponing the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The manager was known as a skilled temporizer in the office.
meanings.sent3: The temporizer's constant delays made everyone frustrated.
meanings.sent4: She was a master temporizer, always finding excuses to stall.
meanings.sent5: The temporizer's tactics of procrastination were evident to all.

meanings.definition: To act evasively in order to gain time.
meanings.sent1: He would temporize whenever asked about his whereabouts.
meanings.sent2: The politician tried to temporize when questioned about the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to temporize his way out of submitting the assignment.
meanings.sent4: She had to temporize her response to avoid revealing the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to temporize to gather more evidence before making an arrest.
